riddle: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest person can't hold me for much longer than a minute. What am I?
What has a key but can’t open locks?
I am a seven-letter word. I am very heavy. Take away two letters, and you'll get eight. What am I?
In days of old, I was revered. A symbol of power, greatly feared. Carved from stone with eyes that gleam. Guarding treasures in my ancient scheme. What am I?
I am taken from a mine, and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
I am not alive, but I can grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
Why did the JavaScript developer go broke?
rightanswer: Because he used up all his 'cache!'

riddle: Why did the JavaScript function break up with its partner?
rightanswer: Because they had too many 'arguments' and couldn't 'resolve'their issues!
wronganswer: Because they had too many 'variables' and couldn't 'assign'their values!

riddle: Why did the server go to therapy?
rightanswer: Because it had too many 'clients' and needed to 'process' its feelings!
wronganswer: Because it couldn't take it any more!

riddle: Why did the CSS file break up with the HTML file?
rightanswer: Because it felt like it was being 'styled' too much and needed some 'space' to 'float' freely!
wronganswer: Because it was too 'dense' and couldn't 'compress' its code properly!

riddle: Why did the CSS file go to jail?
wronganswer: It forgot to indent its code properly!

riddle: Which of the following programming languages was named after a comedy television show?
rightanswer: Ruby, named after a sketch in 'Monty Python’s Flying Circus.'
wronganswer: Java, named after a sketch in 'The three stooges.'
